relations.head: PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell
relations.label: promote
relations.text: Cell function analysis demonstrated that PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell can promote epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and angiogenesis in BLCA cells.

relations.head: PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell
relations.label: promote
relations.text: Cell function analysis demonstrated that PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell can promote epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and angiogenesis in BLCA cells.

relations.head: PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell
relations.label: promote
relations.text: Moreover, BLCA patients with a high level of PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell showed immunotherapy resistance.

relations.head: GAS6
relations.label: bind
relations.text: PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cells were shown to communicate with malignant BLCA cells through the GAS6-AXL axis.

relations.head: METTL3
relations.label: methylate
relations.text: Finally, we also found that GAS6 expression is upregulated in B cells by METTL3-mediated m6A modification.

relations.head: m6A
relations.label: is on
relations.text: Finally, we also found that GAS6 expression is upregulated in B cells by METTL3-mediated m6A modification.

analysis:
Context:  
The study investigates the mechanism in bladder cancer (BLCA), which is an explicitly stated disease context.  
• Context Name: bladder cancer  
• Context Type: disease  

Nodes:  
1) PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell → Tissue/Cell Type (up in bladder cancer)  
2) B cell → Tissue/Cell Type (none)  
3) GAS6 → Protein (up in bladder cancer)  
4) AXL → Protein (none)  
5) METTL3 → Gene (none)  
6) N6-methyladenosine (m6A) → Epitranscriptomic modification (none)  
7) epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) → Biological Process (none)  
8) angiogenesis → Biological Process (none)  
9) immunotherapy resistance → Clinical Phenotype (none)  

Regulatory Relationships (directly stated in the abstract):  
1) PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell promotes epithelial-mesenchymal transition.  
2) PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell promotes angiogenesis.  
3) PD1hi CD200hi CD4+ exhausted T cell promotes immunotherapy resistance.  
4) GAS6 binds AXL.  
5) METTL3 methylates m6A; via a meta-relation, this increases GAS6.  
6) m6A is on GAS6.
